member.name: M:Dragablz.Dockablz.Layout.Branch(Dragablz.TabablzControl,System.Windows.Controls.Orientation,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a split in a layout, at the location of a specified .
member.param: Tab control to be split.
Direction of split.
Set to true to make the current tab control push into the right hand or bottom of the split.
member.remarks: The tab control to be split must be hosted in a layout control.

member.name: M:Dragablz.Dockablz.Layout.Branch(Dragablz.TabablzControl,System.Windows.Controls.Orientation,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a split in a layout, at the location of a specified .
member.param: Tab control to be split.
Direction of split.
Set to true to make the current tab control push into the right hand or bottom of the split.
Sets the proportion of the first tab control, with 0.5 being 50% of available space.
member.remarks: The tab control to be split must be hosted in a layout control. should be set (typically via XAML).

member.name: M:Dragablz.Dockablz.Layout.Branch(Dragablz.TabablzControl,Dragablz.TabablzControl,System.Windows.Controls.Orientation,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a split in a layout, at the location of a specified .
member.param: Tab control to be split.
New sibling tab control (otherwise will be used).
Direction of split.
Set to true to make the current tab control push into the right hand or bottom of the split.
Sets the proportion of the first tab control, with 0.5 being 50% of available space.
member.remarks: The tab control to be split must be hosted in a layout control.

member.name: F:Dragablz.DragablzItem.IsCustomThumbProperty
member.summary: templates contain a thumb, which is used to drag the item around. For most scenarios this is fine, but by setting this flag to true you can define a custom thumb in your content, without having to override the template. This can be useful if you have extra content; such as a custom button that you want the user to be able to interact with (as usually the default thumb will handle mouse interaction).

member.name: M:Dragablz.DragablzItem.SetIsCustomThumb(System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb,System.Boolean)
member.summary: templates contain a thumb, which is used to drag the item around. For most scenarios this is fine, but by setting this flag to true you can define a custom thumb in your content, without having to override the template. This can be useful if you have extra content; such as a custom button that you want the user to be able to interact with (as usually the default thumb will handle mouse interaction).

member.name: P:Dragablz.InterTabController.Partition
member.summary: The partition allows on or more tab environments in a single application. Only tabs which have a tab controller with a common partition will be allowed to have tabs dragged between them. null is a valid partition (i.e global).

member.summary: A linear position monitor simplifies the montoring of the order of items, where they are laid out horizontally or vertically (typically via a .

member.remarks: A can be used to listen to changes instead of routed events, which can be easier in a MVVM scenario.

member.name: P:Dragablz.Referenceless.SerialDisposable.Disposable
member.summary: Gets or sets the underlying disposable.

member.summary: Disposes the underlying disposable as well as all future replacements.

member.summary: Helper method which returns all the currently loaded instances.

member.name: M:Dragablz.TabablzControl.CloseItem(System.Object)
member.summary: Helper method to close all tabs where the item is the tab's content (helpful with MVVM scenarios)
member.remarks: In MVVM scenarios where you don't want to bind the routed command to your ViewModel, with this helper method and embedding the TabablzControl in a UserControl, you can keep the View-specific dependencies out of the ViewModel.
member.param: An existing Tab item content (a ViewModel in MVVM scenarios) which is backing a tab control

member.name: M:Dragablz.TabablzControl.AddItem(System.Object,System.Object,Dragablz.AddLocationHint)
member.summary: Helper method to add an item next to an existing item.
member.remarks: Due to the organisable nature of the control, the order of items may not reflect the order in the source collection. This method will add items to the source collection, managing their initial appearance on screen at the same time. If you are using a this will be used to add the item into the source collection.
member.param: New item to add.
Existing object/tab item content which defines which tab control should be used to add the object.
Location, relative to the object

member.summary: Indicates whether a default add button should be displayed. Alternately an add button could be added in or , utilising .

member.summary: Gets or sets the location to add new tab items in the header.
